description:
We meet at the Herman-Debroux metro station, the end of line 5, outside on the sidewalk at 10h00. If you have trouble finding the group, you can SMS or call Manuela at 0488268920.


Vero will be leading this hike. Be kind to her - she is well prepared but has never done this route before. It will be 10-15 kilometers through the Zonienwoud forest. The return to Brussels will be by bus.


Lunch is in the forest, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.


If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.

Enjoy the hike!

Wessel
name: Vero's Pentecost Hike (Wessel won't be there!)

description:
15km at moderate pace - everyone in decent shape can keep up.

We're meeting at 10h00 at Brussels Midi station, at the NMBS information booth in the middle of the central hall, at track 7/8. If you have trouble finding us, call Wessel at [masked] 06. We're taking the train at 10h21, so make sure you meet us at 10h00 sharp, with your train ticket already purchased! You can buy a round trip to Halle. We'll be back in Brussels around 17h.

Lunch is in the forest, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!

Wessel
name: 15km hike in Hallerbos and Kluisbos (train to Halle)

description:
We meet at the Stalle tram station at 10h30, outside on the sidewalk. If you have trouble finding the group, you can SMS or call Manuela at 0488268920. We start walking at 11h00 sharp, don't be late!


Vero will be leading this hike. She liked the first time so much, she wants to do it again!

This will be the promenade vert clockwise. She will choose the end point during the hike, and it won't be at the starting point for sure, but will be at a public transportation link, so car people can make their way back that way. The distance will be 10-15km.


Lunch is during the hike, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.


If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.

Enjoy the hike!

Wessel
name: Vero's Promenade Vert Hike

description:
We meet at Brussels Central Station at 10h15 upstairs where the big board is with all the train times. Make sure you meet us there and buy your train ticket to "Pecrot" before that! Call or SMS Wessel ([masked]) if you have trouble finding us.


For those who prefer to drive, we arrive at 11h48 at Pecrot station, and we come back to the same place (it's a loop).


We take the train at 10h40 to Leuven and then Pecrot, and do a 20km hike around Pecrot and Wavre. Lunch is during the hike, and you need to bring your own food, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! We should be back in Brussels by 18h at the latest.

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.


If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.
name: 20km hike: lake and forest and fields around Pecrot and Wavre (1hr train ride)

description:
We meet at Brussels Central Station at 10h15 upstairs where the big board is with all the train times. Make sure you meet us there and buy your train ticket to Leuven before that! Call or SMS Wessel ([masked]) if you have trouble finding us.


We take the train at 10h40 from Brussels Central Station to Leuven, and do a 20km hike. Lunch is in the forest, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! We should be back in Brussels by 18h at the latest.

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.


If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.
name: 20km hike south of Leuven

description:
What to see:
The walk starts at the NMBS trainstation in Sint-Joris-Weert. Included in the walk: walking in/through fields, walking over wooden plank footpaths through wetlands, a view over a nice big pond from a watch tower, forests, beautiful vistas over the grain fields and the villages, a nice horse farm from 1756, a castle from 1770 and a church in the neo-roman style, and hopefully there is no mud. (last week there was still mud in some areas)

How to get there:
Meetup at 9:30 at Brussel Nord, with ticket ready (two-way to Sint-Joris-Weert). If you have trouble finding us, call Wessel at [masked] 06. Take train IC 1508, gate 3 towards Leuven at 9:45. In Leuven wait and take train L 6460 (gate D) at 10:28 to Sint-Joris-Weert. At 10:42 you will arrive at the destination. People that come by car or bike (only 15km if you live in east Brussels) please be at the train station in Sint-Joris-Weert at the same time. Train back to Leuven: every hour at 19 past the hour.

What to bring:
Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots (chance there is mud), and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:
If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike: Dijlevalley, Sint-Joris-Weert, Doode Bemde, Neerijse

description:
What to see:

We start the hike at Veltem station at 10:13. Although this is not Holland, one of the first things we will see is a windmill. Then we set course to Bertemforest. On the other side of the forest is Bertem which has Romanesque church from the 11th century. At Bertem we cross the highway to get to at least some small hill. Because now we are getting far away from the starting area, we will walk over country roads towards Meerbeek. When we get close we turn back into Bertemforest again to get to Veltem.


The hike is 19 km if everything goes okay and we have at most 7 hours. If necessary we can shorten the hike and go the Erps-Kwerps station on our way back.


How to get there:


Meetup at 9:30 at Brussel Central Station, with ticket ready. Wessel is on vacation in France, so you'll have to find your own way around the train station - don't worry, it's easy! Take the train to Veltem, direction Leuven, gate 5. Arjen will be waiting for you at Veltem.


How to get back:

- Every 13 min on the hour there is a train to Leuven (gate 4). in Leuven take the IC , gate 2 back to Brussels. 

- Every 47 on the hour there is a train to Brussel gate 1

- If we are really in time pressure we can go to Erps-Kwerps station. Every 9 on the hour to Leuven (IC back to B.) and 51 to Brussel

What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike with Arjen: Veltem and Bertem

description:

Lunch is in the forest, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! We should be back in Brussels by 18h at the latest.

description:
What to see:

The actual hike starts at 11:09 from Erps-Kwerps station. 100m away from the station we will already be out of the residential zone. We will walk through fields and forests mainly, although we will cross some residential zones as well. I prefer to walk on quiet, unpaved roads if possible.


How to get there:

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 10h30 at the latest, with your train ticket (round trip to Erps-Kwerps) ready. The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times. Wessel will be waiting there from 10h20.


At 10:40, take the L-3659 (slow train) from track 5 train to Erps-Kwerps (direction Leuven). At 11:09 you will arrive in Erps-Kwerps. Arjen will be waiting for you there.

How to get back:

Every 9 on the hour take the train to Leuven (take IC back to Brussel.) and every 51 take the train directly to Brussel

What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday noon, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike with Arjen: Erps-Kwerps, fields and forests

description:
What to see:

The actual hike starts at 10:37 from Braine-Le-Comte ('s Gravenbrake) station. From the station we will start to go to the forest of Houssiere, made famous by the Brabant killers/les tueurs du Brabant/De bende van Nijvel.


On the other side of the forest, we start to walk through fields towards the inclined canal plane of Ronquières. This is a huge technological marvel to move ships 68m up or down over an inclined pane of 1400m. But it is/was also famous as a Grands travaux inutile, a big useless work. Luckily, nowadays it transports 5000 ships a year so it is not useless anymore.


From here we go back, again through the fields and forests to Braine-Le-Comte.


I prefer to walk on quiet, unpaved roads if possible. However in this region there aren't many of those. So we will have to walk over small paved roads as well, and there may be cars on those. 

How to get there:

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 10h00 at the latest, with your train tickets ready. The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times. Wessel is not able to join the hike, so you'll have to find your own way around the train station - don't worry, it's easy!


At 10:10, take the train to Braine-Le-Comte, direction Binche, gate 4. At 10:37 you will arrive in Braine-Le-Comte. Arjen will be waiting for you there.

How to get back:

Every 23 (gate 7), 46 (gate 5) and 56 (gate 1) on the hour take the train to Brussel.


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday noon, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike with Arjen: Braine-Le-Comte and the Ronquières inclined canal plane

description:
What to see:

The actual hike starts at 10:47 from Eppegem station gate 1. After leaving the village, we will walk through the countryside with lots of farmland. After 15km and walking through fields, maybe seeing some Mechelse koekoeks and going around a lake we enter the city of Mechelen.

Mechelen is a city that flourished from the 13th to the 15th century, but became one of the first Flemish cities that had its economic growth squandered by the bureaucrats from Brussel, already in the 16th century. ;-). Therefore, the city is full of late medieval and early renaissance architecture. For example, the palace of Margaret of York is the oldest renaissance building north of the Alps.


I prefer to walk on quiet, unpaved roads if possible. However in this region there aren't many of those. So we will have to walk over many small paved roads as well, and there may be cars on those. In the end we enter Mechelen.


How to get there:

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 10h15 at the latest, with your train tickets ready. The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times. Wessel is not able to join the hike, so you'll have to find your own way around the train station - don't worry, it's easy!

At 10:29, take the train to Eppegem, direction Mechelen, gate 5. At 10:47 you will arrive in Eppegem, gate 1. Arjen will be waiting for you there at the gate.

It's probably the cheapest to buy a weekend-retour to Mechelen Nekkerspoel.


How to get back:

To Brussel:


Every 11 (gate 4) to Brussel-Nat-Luchthaven gate2->gate 3 to Brussel-Central

Every 30 (gate 4) directly to Brussel-Central

To Eppegem:

From Mechelen-Central station every 5 (gate 8)


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday noon, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike with Arjen: from Eppegem to Mechelen: farms and the city

description:
The actual hike starts at 10:42 from tramstation Tervuren on the Leuvensesteenweg in Tervuren.  This is very close to the Africa museum, here we will walk in the gardens. Then to Vossem on the 'voetwegske'. There we turn to Duisberg and Overijse and walk through a farmland area. To get back to Tervuren we walk through a forest. 

I prefer to walk on quiet, unpaved roads if possible. There are plenty of those in this area. There may be mud


How to get there:

Meet at the tram 44 stop at Metro station Montgomery at 10:15 at the latest, with your tram fare or ticket ready. Neither Wessel nor me will be waiting here. You have to find the group yourself. This is likely not that difficult: look for a group with hiking clothes/booths etc.


At 10:21, take the tram to Tervuren. At 10:42 you will arrive in end-station called Tervuren. Arjen will be waiting for you there at the gate.

How to get back:

Tram 44 to Montgomery goes every 20 minutes. Typically every 05, 25 and 45 on the hour.


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

name: Vero's Promenade Vert Hike - Part three!

description:
Please read the whole text before RSVP'ing

What to see?

'This walk is not suitable for people who are easily impressed' is the text on a sign - one of the warnings you will find about this hike. This hike is more challenging and more difficult than our others hikes. On wikiloc, it is one of the few "très difficile" routes. But it is an "offical" route with signs showing you the way around the track.

But why go through all this trouble? It is apparently one of the most beautiful hikes in Belgium. You walk next to the Semois river in the deep Ardennes, so there is that. And there are ladders.


The Les-Echelles route is 5km long and takes 3 hours, but I want to/will extend the route so that we will walk for 5 hours.


Best description of route I could find is only in Dutch: http://www.hiking.be/?6


but google translation to the rescue.


This hike will be by car - how will it work?

Because this place is impossible to reach by public transportation, we'll go by car. For 8 people, we need only two cars. Arjen provides one, so we'll need someone else to also drive. The drivers will be compensated for the cost by their fellow passengers, of course. To make sure we'll be efficient, we'll determine the meetup point for each car based on where the driver and the passengers live. Arjen will coordinate this. It also means we'll need people to commit to the hike and not cancel only a few days/hours before.

Why/What is an 'experienced hikers only' walk?


- Because of the difficulty of the terrain we want to only walk with maximum 8 people so that we can move at a reasonable pace. We want people who are able to do this hike without a problem.


- This area is best/only reachable by car. This requires more planning and we do not want people to cancel their RSVPs on the last moment and leave seats open in the cars.

- This is the first time I'm doing a more difficult hike/planning with a group


To join this hike, please RSVP to this hike and answer the few extra questions. The secret word is peanut-butter-jelly-time btw. Then, everyone will be placed on the waiting list. Two weeks before the hike we'll confirm the 8 people, based on their experience levels (that we have seen on past hikes). Please do not cancel your reservation less then a week in advance.

Additional information

Please bring your own lunch, enough water (1.5L minimum), and good hiking shoes with good grip. This time it is needed! Probably it will be around 21h when we get back to Brussel (2h drive),  so we'll eat in Rochehaut - there's a great restaurant that's very affordabe (see price list at The Taverne de la Fermette).


Cost

You pay 20 euro to your driver. It is about 300km which comes to 26cents/km/car (To compare, the fiscal travel compensation by car is[masked])
name: For experienced hikers: Les Echelles de Rochehaut

description:
Meeting point: Stuyvenbergh - line 6 direction roi boudewijn. Take exit No 4. Vero will be waiting outside near the exit.

If you have trouble finding the group, you can SMS or call Wessel at +31652823406. We start walking at 11h00 sharp, don't be late!


Vero will be leading this hike.

This will be the promenade vert clockwise. She will choose the end point during the hike, and it won't be at the starting point for sure, but will be at a public transportation link, so car people can make their way back that way. The distance will be 10-15km.

Wessel
name: Vero's Promenade Vert Hike - Part four!

description:
Note: Back in Brussels on 19:30!


What to see:

The actual hike starts at 11:38  from Villers-la-Ville station. Villers-la-Ville is probably the one of closest-by, middle-of-nowhere backwaters with a train station. Only every two hours there is a train to the village and there are no buses on sunday. So it is a really small village, but in typical Belgium style, there are three somewhat-expensive restaurants, a bakery, and a butcher. There may be even a frituur kot, although I don't see it in Google streetview/maps.


After leaving the village, we will walk through a forest. We will see a Ferme du Moulin, whatever that is, and Chateau Cocriamont.  Here, we will turn north, go through a small patch of open fields, and into another forest. We will stay almost the full way to La Roche in this forest. We cross the railroad and go into a more hilly forest area. We will keep on walking this hilly area until we reach the abbey of Villers-la-Ville. To enter the grounds of the abbey you to pay an entrance fee, but we will hike around it, so that is for free.


It is now a ruin, but used to be a beautiful 13th century Cistercian abbey. The Cistercian are an order following the teaching of St. Benedict and didn't like the way the Benedictines order was developing. The Cisterians returned to a focus of manual labor. Furthermore they had a keen interest in technology. They especially improved farming, hydraulic and metallurgy methods all though out Europe.


Btw, a reform of the Cisterian order in the 17th century are the now famous beer makers, the Trappists. But at that time the Villers abbey was already in a large decline due to money problems and a failure to stick to the original teachings of st. Benedict as well.


On the site there is no beer, but there are a few bars in the area. From here it is a short track to the station.


I prefer to walk on quiet, unpaved roads if possible. There are plenty of those here. There may be mud.

How to get there:

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 10:30 at the latest, with your train tickets ready. The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times.


At 10:37, take the train to Ottignes, direction Luxembourgh, gate 3. At 11:22 Switch at Ottignes to gate 11, direction Chaleroi Sud. At 11:38 you will arrive in Villers. Arjen will be waiting for you there at the gate.

How to get back:

To Brussels: Either at 16:26, or 18:23 or 20:23. Most like we take the 18:23.  1h ride.


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decided not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday noon, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20 km hike around Villers-la-Ville, an abandonned abbey and forsaken expats

description:
We start, fittingly, at Manneken Pis. The group gathers at 8h45, for a 9h00 sharp departure. Eamon will lead the hike. This hike is for experienced hikers only, who have recently done 20km and longer hikes. 

If you decide not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.


Here's Eamon's detailed description in full:

Warning : This walk is for experienced day walkers only 

You can travel from Brussels to Leuven by train in less than 30 minutes, or if you have time to spare it takes a little more than an hour on the bus. But it is possible to walk in a single day....... 

No matter what the weather or how much you had to drink the night before we will start at 9am from Manneken Pis. 

Before we start I will ask a Japanese tourist to take a group photo with a pissing boy in the background 

Best if you are there a few minutes before hand as we start at 9am exactly 

There will be multiple short stops on the route and we can take 30 minutes or so for you to enjoy your packed lunch and favorite beverage 

The pace will be brisk as we do have to cover the distance before night falls 

I expect to arrive between 6-7pm at the statue of the drinking boy in Leuven, where again I will ask a tourist to take a photograph with the statue in the background of the survivors 

If you make it, I will buy you a well deserved beer...... 

Again, I need to emphasis that this walk is for experienced walkers only, who have experience of 30+ Km walks and enjoy a challenge rather than a moan 

The route is defined and can be viewed or downloaded from the link below. We shall not deviate from the route and will be tracking by GPS so there is no possibility to get lost or add additional Kms to the already long walk 

You know yourself what shoes to bring and how much food and water you need for a full day 

My number is <a>[masked]</a> 


http://www.routeyou.com/route/view/2539893/recreational-walking-route/brussels-to-leuven.en

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decide not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.
name: 26km from Welkenraedt to "three countries point" (bring your passport!)

description:
What to see:

Hike starts at 11:05 from Diest station. People in Leuven sometimes call the area in between Diest-Aarschot-Tienen the marginal triangle  (De marginale driehoek). They claim this area apparently 'het Maaskantje' of Belgium (they wish!). According to a (sadly removed) wikipedia-page this area is full of soccer hooligans, pimped-out cars, XTC, and low-lifes. Jumpstyle also originated here. Jumpstyle is, of course, the slower/Belgium variant of gabber (When watching this movie I want to back to that hall again) But we will hike only on the border of the triangle and see lots of nature.

We will walk a long while next to the Demer river, but also through forests and through hopefully heather areas (at least in name). We will see the Maagdentoren of Zichem, a tower nobody really knows why it was build. Furthermore, we will see the begijnhof of Aarschot.


How to get there:

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 09h45 at the latest, with your train tickets ready - Wessel will be there. The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times.


At 10:02 we take the train to Eupen on track 1, get out at Leuven and take at 10:37 the train on track 3 to Diest. Arjen will be joining you in the train at Aarschot..

It's probably the cheapest to buy a weekend-retour to Diest.

Car people: Go to Aarschot, free parking and take the train at 10:48 on track 3 to Diest.


How to get back:

To Brussel: every 41 and 25 on the hour, track 1


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers!

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decide not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday noon, so that someone else can go in your place. Hope to see you there!
name: 20km hike: from Diest to Aarschot: one side of the marginal triangle

description:
An early start for an adventure that will not be a challenge for the experienced walkers among us. We will never go more than 17 meters above sea level, so guaranteed to arrive in Brugge well before sunset. Plenty of time to enjoy the delights of the city before dark. Expected arrival time in Brugge is4-5pm

How to get there :

Meet at Brussels Central Station at 09h00 at the latest, with your train tickets ready . The meeting location is upstairs where the big board is with all the train times.

At 09:21 we take the train to Bruges on track 4 and expect to arrive at Aalter around 10h11

The Route :

The route is defined and can be viewed or downloaded from the link below. We shall not deviate from the route and will be tracking by GPS so there is no possibility to get lost or add additional Kms to the already long walk

You know yourself what shoes to bring and how much food and water you need for a full day.

My number is <a>[masked]</a>

<a>http://www.routeyou.com/route/view/2652149/hiking-route/aalter-to-brugge-25km-16miles.en</a>;


If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decide not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.
name: 25km from Aalter to Brugge with Eamon

description:
Procedure:

You are placed automatically on the waitlist. When you have bought thalys tickets (thalys.be) message me or post in the comments. Then I'll place you in the going category.

This is because we go by high-speed train. Thus we need commitment early, otherwise the train tickets are much more expensive. Currently the train ticket is 19 euro to and 25 euro back.


When we have 20-25 people in the going-list, the hike is full and I'll edit the text here to show this.


One month prior to the hike, if it is not full yet, I'll use the regular meetup method. So if you RSVP then and there is space you can join automatically. Because then you probably have to travel by regular train because the price of the thalys will be too high. 

What to see:

The actual hike starts at 11:18 from station Herzogenrath. Here we will follow the river Wurm into Aachen. It is a small meandering river that has it source just south of Aachen and enters the Rur up north. Its name comes from the word warm but this time of year it is still not a good idea to fall into it. For this part of the hike, prepare for mud.

We enter Aachen from the north. Aachen has the oldest cathedral of Northern Europe, the Kaiserdom, where the throne of Charlemagne resides. They have a beautiful city hall dated 13:30, luscious Aachener printen bakeries and the easy going Weihnachtsmarkt. Have some gluwein and currywurst!


In addition, the Lindt Werksverkauf is open this day. This is a chocolate shop of the size of a regular supermarket and probably very crowded. It is however 15 minutes walking out of the center. Still interesting to see.


How to get there:

Take the 9:28 Thalys from Brussel Midi to Aachen. Then take the local train to Herzogenrath at 11:02 on gate 1. Arjen will be waiting for you in Herzogenrath.

How to get back:

With the Thalys back to Brussels at 19:23. You will arrive on 21:00 (cheaper ticket).


What to bring:

Lunch is on the route, and you need to bring your own lunch, and enough water (1L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! Also prepare for mud.

Additional info:

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.
name: 15km hike to the Aachener Weihnachtsmarkt/Christmas-fare

description:
After the holidays, we'll all want to stretch our legs and walk off all those calories. But alas, we'll be out of shape and lazy. So a 'cool' hike - late start, no trains, and 15km in the Zonienwoud, in our own cozy Brussels. We finish at Belga cafe.

Lunch is on the way, and you need to bring your own lunch, enough water (1.5L minimum), good hiking boots, and your favorite fellow hikers! We should be finished by 18h at the latest.

Our speed will be moderate. This means anyone in decent shape will be able to keep up.

If you bring extra people, make sure you add them as a +1 on the RVSP, so we have an accurate headcount. If you decide not to go, please change your RSVP to 'no' before noon on Saturday, so that someone else can go in your place.
how_to_find_us: We'll meet on the Flagey square next to the friterie!
name: Post holiday recovery walk: 15km through Brussel forest plus tea/beer after!
